summary.long: Galatians is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: Paul, an apostle (not sent from men nor through human agency, but through Jesus Christ and God the Father, who raised Him from the dead),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and all the brothers who are with me,
To the churches of Galatia:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Grace to you and peace from God the Father and our Lord Jesus Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who gave Himself for our sins so that He might rescue us from this present evil age, according to the will of our God and Father,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to whom be the glory forevermore. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am amazed that you are so quickly deserting Him who called you by the grace of Christ, for a different gospel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which is not just another account; but there are some who are disturbing you and want to distort the gospel of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But even if we, or an angel from heaven, should preach to you a gospel contrary to what we have preached to you, he is to be accursed!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As we have said before, even now I say again: if anyone is preaching to you a gospel contrary to what you received, he is to be accursed!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For am I now seeking the favor of people, or of God? Or am I striving to please people? If I were still trying to please people, I would not be a bond-servant of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I would have you know, brothers and sisters, that the gospel which was preached by me is not of human invention.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I neither received it from man, nor was I taught it, but I received it through a revelation of Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you have heard of my former way of life in Judaism, how I used to persecute the church of God beyond measure and tried to destroy it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I was advancing in Judaism beyond many of my contemporaries among my countrymen, being more extremely zealous for my ancestral traditions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when He who had set me apart even from my mother’s womb and called me through His grace was pleased
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to reveal His Son in me so that I might preach Him among the Gentiles, I did not immediately consult with flesh and blood,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: nor did I go up to Jerusalem to those who were apostles before me; but I went away to Arabia, and returned once more to Damascus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then three years later I went up to Jerusalem to become acquainted with Cephas, and stayed with him for fifteen days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I did not see another one of the apostles except James, the Lord’s brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now in what I am writing to you, I assure you before God that I am not lying.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I went into the regions of Syria and Cilicia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was still unknown by sight to the churches of Judea which are in Christ;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but they only kept hearing, “The man who once persecuted us is now preaching the faith which he once tried to destroy.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were glorifying God because of me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then after an interval of fourteen years I went up again to Jerusalem with Barnabas, taking Titus along also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was because of a revelation that I went up; and I submitted to them the gospel which I preach among the Gentiles, but I did so in private to those who were of reputation, for fear that somehow I might be running, or had run, in vain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But not even Titus, who was with me, though he was a Greek, was compelled to be circumcised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet it was a concern because of the false brothers secretly brought in, who had sneaked in to spy on our freedom which we have in Christ Jesus, in order to enslave us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we did not yield in subjection to them, even for an hour, so that the truth of the gospel would remain with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But from those who were of considerable repute (what they were makes no difference to me; God shows no favoritism)—well, those who were of repute contributed nothing to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But on the contrary, seeing that I had been entrusted with the gospel to the uncircumcised, just as Peter had been to the circumcised
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (for He who was at work for Peter in his apostleship to the circumcised was at work for me also to the Gentiles),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and recognizing the grace that had been given to me, James and Cephas and John, who were reputed to be pillars, gave to me and Barnabas the right hand of fellowship, so that we might go to the Gentiles, and they to the circumcised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They only asked us to remember the poor—the very thing I also was eager to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Cephas came to Antioch, I opposed him to his face, because he stood condemned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For prior to the coming of some men from James, he used to eat with the Gentiles; but when they came, he began to withdraw and separate himself, fearing those from the circumcision.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rest of the Jews joined him in hypocrisy, with the result that even Barnabas was carried away by their hypocrisy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when I saw that they were not straightforward about the truth of the gospel, I said to Cephas in the presence of all, “If you, being a Jew, live like the Gentiles and not like the Jews, how is it that you compel the Gentiles to live like Jews?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “We are Jews by nature and not sinners from the Gentiles;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: nevertheless, knowing that a person is not justified by works of the Law but through faith in Christ Jesus, even we have believed in Christ Jesus, so that we may be justified by faith in Christ and not by works of the Law; since by works of the Law no flesh will be justified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if, while seeking to be justified in Christ, we ourselves have also been found sinners, is Christ then a servant of sin? Far from it!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if I rebuild what I have once destroyed, I prove myself to be a wrongdoer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For through the Law I died to the Law, so that I might live for God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have been crucified with Christ; and it is no longer I who live, but Christ lives in me; and the life which I now live in the flesh I live by faith in the Son of God, who loved me and gave Himself up for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I do not nullify the grace of God, for if righteousness comes through the Law, then Christ died needlessly.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You foolish Galatians, who has bewitched you, before whose eyes Jesus Christ was publicly portrayed as crucified?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the only thing I want to find out from you: did you receive the Spirit by works of the Law, or by hearing with faith?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are you so foolish? Having begun by the Spirit, are you now being perfected by the flesh?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Did you suffer so many things in vain—if indeed it was in vain?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then, does He who provides you with the Spirit and works miracles among you, do it by works of the Law, or by hearing with faith?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just as Abraham believed God, and it was credited to him as righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, recognize that it is those who are of faith who are sons of Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Scripture, foreseeing that God would justify the Gentiles by faith, preached the gospel beforehand to Abraham, saying, “All the nations will be blessed in you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then, those who are of faith are blessed with Abraham, the believer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For all who are of works of the Law are under a curse; for it is written: “Cursed is everyone who does not abide by all the things written in the book of the Law, to do them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, that no one is justified by the Law before God is evident; for, “the righteous one will live by faith.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, the Law is not of faith; on the contrary, “The person who performs them will live by them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Christ redeemed us from the curse of the Law, having become a curse for us—for it is written: “Cursed is everyone who hangs on a tree”—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in order that in Christ Jesus the blessing of Abraham would come to the Gentiles, so that we would receive the promise of the Spirit through faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Brothers and sisters, I speak in terms of human relations: even though it is only a man’s covenant, yet when it has been ratified, no one sets it aside or adds conditions to it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the promises were spoken to Abraham and to his seed. He does not say, “And to seeds,” as one would in referring to many, but rather as in referring to one, “And to your seed,” that is, Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What I am saying is this: the Law, which came 430 years later, does not invalidate a covenant previously ratified by God, so as to nullify the promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if the inheritance is based on law, it is no longer based on a promise; but God has granted it to Abraham by means of a promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why the Law then? It was added on account of the violations, having been ordered through angels at the hand of a mediator, until the Seed would come to whom the promise had been made.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now a mediator is not for one party only; but God is only one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is the Law then contrary to the promises of God? Far from it! For if a law had been given that was able to impart life, then righteousness would indeed have been based on law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Scripture has confined everyone under sin, so that the promise by faith in Jesus Christ might be given to those who believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But before faith came, we were kept in custody under the Law, being confined for the faith that was destined to be revealed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the Law has become our guardian to lead us to Christ, so that we may be justified by faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now that faith has come, we are no longer under a guardian.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you are all sons and daughters of God through faith in Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For all of you who were baptized into Christ have clothed yourselves with Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is neither Jew nor Greek, there is neither slave nor free, there is neither male nor female; for you are all one in Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if you belong to Christ, then you are Abraham’s descendants, heirs according to promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I say, as long as the heir is a child, he does not differ at all from a slave, although he is owner of everything,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but he is under guardians and managers until the date set by the father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So we too, when we were children, were held in bondage under the elementary principles of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the fullness of the time came, God sent His Son, born of a woman, born under the Law,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that He might redeem those who were under the Law, that we might receive the adoption as sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because you are sons, God has sent the Spirit of His Son into our hearts, crying out, “Abba! Father!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore you are no longer a slave, but a son; and if a son, then an heir through God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However at that time, when you did not know God, you were slaves to those which by nature are not gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now that you have come to know God, or rather to be known by God, how is it that you turn back again to the weak and worthless elementary principles, to which you want to be enslaved all over again?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You meticulously observe days and months and seasons and years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I fear for you, that perhaps I have labored over you in vain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I beg of you, brothers and sisters, become as I am, for I also have become as you are. You have done me no wrong;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but you know that it was because of a bodily illness that I preached the gospel to you the first time;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you did not despise that which was a trial to you in my bodily condition, nor express contempt, but you received me as an angel of God, as Christ Jesus Himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Where then is that sense of blessing you had? For I testify about you that, if possible, you would have torn out your eyes and given them to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So have I become your enemy by telling you the truth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They eagerly seek you, not in a commendable way, but they want to shut you out so that you will seek them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But it is good always to be eagerly sought in a commendable way, and not only when I am present with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My children, with whom I am again in labor until Christ is formed in you—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but I could wish to be present with you now and to change my tone of voice, for I am at a loss about you!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tell me, you who want to be under law, do you not listen to the Law?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is written that Abraham had two sons, one by the slave woman and one by the free woman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the son by the slave woman was born according to the flesh, and the son by the free woman through the promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is speaking allegorically, for these women are two covenants: one coming from Mount Sinai giving birth to children who are to be slaves; she is Hagar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now this Hagar is Mount Sinai in Arabia and corresponds to the present Jerusalem, for she is enslaved with her children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Jerusalem above is free; she is our mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: And you, brothers and sisters, like Isaac, are children of promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as at that time the son who was born according to the flesh persecuted the one who was born according to the Spirit, so it is even now.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But what does the Scripture say?
“Drive out the slave woman and her son,
For the son of the slave woman shall not be an heir with the son of the free woman.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then, brothers and sisters, we are not children of a slave woman, but of the free woman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was for freedom that Christ set us free; therefore keep standing firm and do not be subject again to a yoke of slavery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look! I, Paul, tell you that if you have yourselves circumcised, Christ will be of no benefit to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I testify again to every man who has himself circumcised, that he is obligated to keep the whole Law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have been severed from Christ, you who are seeking to be justified by the Law; you have fallen from grace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we, through the Spirit, by faith, are waiting for the hope of righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in Christ Jesus neither circumcision nor uncircumcision means anything, but faith working through love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You were running well; who hindered you from obeying the truth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This persuasion did not come from Him who calls you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A little leaven leavens the whole lump of dough.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have confidence in you in the Lord, that you will adopt no other view; but the one who is disturbing you will bear the punishment, whoever he is.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as for me, brothers and sisters, if I still preach circumcision, why am I still persecuted? Then the stumbling block of the cross has been eliminated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I wish that those who are troubling you would even emasculate themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you were called to freedom, brothers and sisters; only do not turn your freedom into an opportunity for the flesh, but serve one another through love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the whole Law is fulfilled in one word, in the statement, “You shall love your neighbor as yourself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you bite and devour one another, take care that you are not consumed by one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I say, walk by the Spirit, and you will not carry out the desire of the flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the desire of the flesh is against the Spirit, and the Spirit against the flesh; for these are in opposition to one another, in order to keep you from doing whatever you want.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you are led by the Spirit, you are not under the Law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the deeds of the flesh are evident, which are: sexual immorality, impurity, indecent behavior,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: idolatry, witchcraft, hostilities, strife, jealousy, outbursts of anger, selfish ambition, dissensions, factions,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: envy, drunkenness, carousing, and things like these, of which I forewarn you, just as I have forewarned you, that those who practice such things will not inherit the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, goodness, faithfulness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: gentleness, self-control; against such things there is no law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now those who belong to Christ Jesus crucified the flesh with its passions and desires.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If we live by the Spirit, let’s follow the Spirit as well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let’s not become boastful, challenging one another, envying one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Brothers and sisters, even if a person is caught in any wrongdoing, you who are spiritual are to restore such a person in a spirit of gentleness; each one looking to yourself, so that you are not tempted as well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bear one another’s burdens, and thereby fulfill the law of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if anyone thinks that he is something when he is nothing, he deceives himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But each one must examine his own work, and then he will have reason for boasting, but to himself alone, and not to another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For each one will bear his own load.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who is taught the word is to share all good things with the one who teaches him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not be deceived, God is not mocked; for whatever a person sows, this he will also reap.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the one who sows to his own flesh will reap destruction from the flesh, but the one who sows to the Spirit will reap eternal life from the Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let’s not become discouraged in doing good, for in due time we will reap, if we do not become weary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then, while we have opportunity, let’s do good to all people, and especially to those who are of the household of the faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See with what large letters I have written to you with my own hand!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All who want to make a good showing in the flesh try to compel you to be circumcised, simply so that they will not be persecuted for the cross of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For those who are circumcised do not even keep the Law themselves, but they want to have you circumcised so that they may boast in your flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But far be it from me to boast, except in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ, through which the world has been crucified to me, and I to the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For neither is circumcision anything, nor uncircumcision, but a new creation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all who will follow this rule, peace and mercy be upon them, and upon the Israel of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From now on let no one cause trouble for me, for I bear on my body the marks of Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit, brothers and sisters. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator
